channel.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
channel.description:
ok.. i have a tru3scape source and ive tried so many differnt things to stop massing... and the main 1 every one tells me is to change the actiontimer....
ive spent hours change them from 0 - as high as 500 and nothing ever makes a differnce...
is there anything anyone knows that would help me out? to make timers more real like rs instead of being able to spam it...
I don't need help setting a timer for objects those work when i set them for skills and stuff but....When fighting a player or a npc you can mass and when i change the timer on those it don't do nothing..
As for the message thing that will just say "Stop massing" I don't want that. i want it to acually not let you mass o.0.... like on i think it's called czar you can't mass while fighting a npc or pvp.
im a bit confussing... sorry but the what i am saying is i want to stop massing for pking and attacking npcs... not objects, or any other skill they all work when i mess with the timers.. any help?

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @omgwater omgwater
item.description:
@omgwater wrote:

thx for the attempt to help i guess…

but what your telling me todo doesnt do much as i don’t get what you mean sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

I would know that this guy has no idea what he’s talking about.

Just make sure you reset the right timer after every action, seeing as they seem to be done so pathetically.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @omgwater omgwater
item.description:
@omgwater wrote:

yes… but obviously set up to differntly… i can change the speed\timer w\e for pvp and pvnpc from 1 source i have but not the other?

ive sent 2 ppl my client.java and they couldnt fix\set the timer for combat either…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 31, 2008, 11:23:54 PM[/size][hr]some guy just said my problem is probley in my playerhandler. would anyone know anything about that?

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @omgwater omgwater
item.description:
@omgwater wrote:

lol… i have so many differnt timers man i don’t get what your saying…

like i said if i change the timer on lets say… runecrafting it will change and work perfect… ppl can’t mass it rcing or anything but…

if i change the timer on a ummmm whip… like pking delay, wepelay, loopdelay or w\e the last 1 is is does not work i can leave a 0 and it be the same if i put it on like 500

this includes mage, melee, and range… i can’t stop ppl from massing when useing any 3 of these…((((P VS NPC & P VS P))))

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

Find wherever the action is carried out, and reset the actionTimer once it’s been carried out.

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @omgwater omgwater
item.description:
@omgwater wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:18, topic:177486”]Let’s say i was training on Npcs.

I WILL only receive XP if i meet the requirements which are:

If my actionTimer is at 0, not anything below or above it.

If my actionTimer was above 0 then it would send that message saying to slow down, you can add a ResetNpcAttack(); and some other shit, and it wouldn’t give them anything.

Oh and the last part what vegeance said is true.

So i set a limit,it will display your name for everytime you click, if it exceeds past like 25 you get ipbanned(I hate massers =)) Though it goes down about 3 every 4 seconds, so if i had 24, in 4 seconds i would have 20, but if i clicked 5 times after that 4 seconds, boom i get ipbanned and disconnected.[/quote]ok but like project czar source you can’t mass on… isn’t it possible to make mine like that? i don’t liek the whole “stop massing or be banned thing” even tho i want them to stop lol… id rather them just not beable to do it o.0… and ive seen 1 other tru3scape source that had no massing on it but i just cant stop massing pvnpc or pvp but any other timer i can slow down\speed up[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 31, 2008, 10:40:48 PM[/size][hr][quote="_Vengeance, post:20, topic:177486"]Have a think about it for a sec. It’s not complicated in any way.[/quote]ive had like 6 days of thinking about it… ive posted daily and heard lots of things to change but nothing works…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:

Have a think about it for a sec. It’s not complicated in any way.

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @omgwater omgwater
item.description:
@omgwater wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:17, topic:177486"]The actionTimer isn’t being reset after every action.
Therefore making the first one take time, but every action after that can just be carried out straight away. Not to mention process is called every time the server receives a packet from the client, ( any time the player does anything ) therefore meaning if they mass on an object, they can still click it faster then the server is suppose to allow.[/quote]ok… and that can be fixed how?

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Let’s say i was training on Npcs.

I WILL only receive XP if i meet the requirements which are:

If my actionTimer is at 0, not anything below or above it.

If my actionTimer was above 0 then it would send that message saying to slow down, you can add a ResetNpcAttack(); and some other shit, and it wouldn’t give them anything.

Oh and the last part what vegeance said is true.

So i set a limit,it will display your name for everytime you click, if it exceeds past like 25 you get ipbanned(I hate massers =)) Though it goes down about 3 every 4 seconds, so if i had 24, in 4 seconds i would have 20, but if i clicked 5 times after that 4 seconds, boom i get ipbanned and disconnected.

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @_Vengeance _Vengeance
item.description:
@_Vengeance wrote:

The actionTimer isn’t being reset after every action.
Therefore making the first one take time, but every action after that can just be carried out straight away. Not to mention process is called every time the server receives a packet from the client, ( any time the player does anything ) therefore meaning if they mass on an object, they can still click it faster then the server is suppose to allow.

Read full topic

item.title: Timers for tru3scape source? help
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Add a condition to whatever you want to people won’t mass on that certain thing.

if(actionTimer == 0) {

That would be the condition.

If it doesn’t meet the condition…

} else if(actionTimer > 0) {
sendMessage(“Slow The Fuck Down”);
}

Read full topic
